revised_title: Liquid Hydrogen and the Production of High Vacua: A Study on Vacuum Exhaustion and Spectroscopy
tldr: The author, James Dewar, investigates the use of liquid hydrogen in producing high vacua and examines its spectroscopic properties. He explores the behavior of gases at low temperatures, specifically nitrogen and oxygen, and their effects on vacuum production. Dewar also discusses the methods for achieving high vacua and the spectroscopic examination of various gases, including hydrogen, carbonic oxide, and other volatile components.
